sections.title: Make Tax Planning a Twelve-Month Habit
sections.subtitle: Shift from reactive filing to proactive decisions that shrink taxes and boost cash flow

sections.title: What You'll Learn
items: Quarterly checkpoints for W-2 earners and business owners
How to plan asset sales, charitable giving, and retirement moves with tax windows in mind
Estimating safe-harbor payments and avoiding penalties
Tools for coordinating accountants, payroll providers, and wealth advisors

sections.title: Quarterly Rhythm
sections.content: Set a recurring calendar reminder every quarter to review paystub withholdings, side-hustle profits, and investment gains. Adjust withholding or estimated payments when income changes. Business owners should align bookkeeping closes with these checkpoints to catch write-offs early.

points.title: Harvest Losses
points.description: Sell underperforming investments to offset capital gains, keeping wash-sale rules in mind.

points.title: Bunch Deductions
points.description: Group charitable gifts and medical expenses into a single tax year so itemized deductions exceed the standard deduction.

points.title: Time Income
points.description: Shift freelance invoices or year-end bonuses across the calendar when you expect bracket changes.

sections.title: Safe Harbor Rules
sections.content: To avoid underpayment penalties, pay 100% of last year's tax (110% if AGI > $150k) or 90% of the current year's projected tax.

sections.title: Collaboration Tools
sections.content: Maintain a shared folder with your CPA containing quarterly financial statements, payroll reports, and tax projections. Use secure e-signature and document portals to streamline approvals and keep an audit trail.

sections.title: Tax Planning Sprint
steps: Create a quarterly calendar invite titled 'Tax Check-In' and attach your latest pay stubs and P&L reports.
Set up estimated tax payments in EFTPS or through your state's revenue portal.
List upcoming life events (weddings, home purchases, education expenses) and note potential tax impacts.
Schedule a mid-year review with your tax professional to adjust strategy before year-end.
Document charitable giving and large deductions in a running spreadsheet with receipt links.

sections.title: Automate Reminders
sections.content: Use task management tools to nudge you 10 days before each quarterly estimated tax deadline (April 15, June 15, September 15, January 15).
